page.title: 01Ingatestone and district.
page.content: The block contains the large village of Ingatestone and the surrounding farmland. Ingatestone has a population of approximately 5000 people and lies roughly half way between Brentwood and Chelmsford. Ingatestone's main function is residential - a substantial proportion of the working population are employed outside the area. Many people work in London and commute daily by train. The gently undulating landscape of the area is typical of much of this part of Essex with the majority of farmland devoted to the growing of crops. Field boundaries are not always well defined reflecting the general absence of livestock. There are occasional patches of woodland especially in the north-east of the block.
